questions.question: In the Newton-Raphson method, the power flow equations are linearized using which mathematical tool?
In the Newton-Raphson power flow method, what is the nature of the Jacobian matrix?
How does the Newton-Raphson method deal with reactive power limits in the system?

answers.a: It switches the bus type from PV to PQ when reactive power limits are violated.
answers.b: It ignores reactive power limits completely.
answers.c: It adjusts the active power generation to stay within limits.
answers.d: It automatically corrects the bus voltages to maintain limits.

questions.question: What is the typical convergence criterion used in the Newton-Raphson method for power flow analysis?

answers.a: Magnitude of power mismatch is less than a specified tolerance
answers.b: Voltage magnitudes are within 5% of the nominal value
answers.d: The generator reactive power is minimized
